result.execSummary:
The defendant Shushika Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Partial payment plan:  $25 per month.  2 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
With Huber for employment and child care. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No violent contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
